intro: Tragia cannabina var. hastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. This species is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
